original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade on Friday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
“There is a bit of a gain, which is moving at a slow pace. Consumer services on the Tourism side is driving the market,” Ranjan Ranatunga of First Capital Holdings said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.32 percent or 30.02 points to 9,426, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.35 percent or 9.65 points to 2,732.59.
“The market is acting on tourism based shares ahead of the peak season, the market is preparing itself and acting in advance which is pushing the sentiment,” Ranatunga said.
The peak season for tourism is between December to mid-April based on weather and therefore overall visitor numbers.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Sampath Bank, Commercial Bank or Melstacorp.
The banking industry has recovered on the points lost after the International Monetary Fund approved the loan to the crisis hit island nation.
During the IMF approval, the overall banking industry has lost 300 points, Ranatunga said.
“This interest for the banking sector is likely to be short lived and lasting, the index will build up until debt restructuring negotiations are concluded,” Ranatunga said.
The market generated a turnover of 1.3 billion rupees.  (Colombo/Mar24/2023)
